snippet: A House divided along unusual and unpredictable lines voted to authorize the training and arming of Syrian rebels to confront the militant group Islamic State, backing President Obama.
abstract: House votes to authorize training and arming of Syrian rebels to confront militant group Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, backing Pres Obama; legislation also grants Obama authority to accept contributions in cash and in kind to help finance the mission; Saudi Arabia has already pledged to host the training of Syrian rebels, and Obama administration promises to vet the fighters for reliability.
lead_paragraph: A House divided along unusual and unpredictable lines voted to authorize the training and arming of Syrian rebels to confront the militant group Islamic State, backing President Obama.

headline.main: House Votes to Authorize Aid to Syrian Rebels in ISIS Fight
headline.print_headline: House Backs Bill to Give Training to Syrian Rebels

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
